question: Which of the following rulers established a new capital named Gangaikondacholapuram?
explanation: In 1022 CE, King Rajendra I defeated the Pala ruler, Mahipal I, and the Western Chalukyas. To commemorate this occasion, he assumed the title of GangaikondacholaÂ and established a new capital named Gangaikondacholapuram near the mouth of the river Kaveri.
